Hi everyone,

In lieu of a #cookies channel, I'm posting this here - feel free to suggest a better place for it :wink:

Our <http://ecommeleon.com|website> is hosted on HubCMS.

Now that HubSpot supports native cookie blocking/scanning, I'm trying to replace the third-party app I was previously using (Cookiebot) for GDPR compliance. Despite removing the script from our site header HTML and disconnecting the app integration, Cookiebot is somehow still active and is blocking the HubSpot scanner/cookie manager from doing its thing.

HubSpot support referred me here, Cookiebot support is non-existent, and I'm left with a non-GDPR compliant website.

Any suggestions for a solution here?
hello team how to check user exit or not in HubSpot api sales
Very grateful for you response <@U01ASFZL4UA> and sorry I didn’t get back to you, I missed this! Have a great day
Hey Jesse - could it be that the old website is just cached? either on HubSpot’s end or on your computer?

Hey Jonathan,
On my side the cookiebot script still shows up regardless of browser/incognito mode etc., and I presume that the HubSpot cookie scanner uses some kind of solution to prevent caching in order to do their monthly scans, so I don't think that's the issue. I haven't been able to get a straight answer out of HS support on this though so I don't know how to check it on their end

Hello, I am trying to pre-render my HubSpot page. I checked my page with `?hsDebugOnly=true`  but HubSpot says the page cannot be pre-render because of this issue:
```    "- This page uses an uncachable value. (value contact)"```
*How can I find out where this value is used?* So far I searched templates and modules for `contact` hubl variable, but it's nowhere used. Any ideas on how to locate it?

Im revising a site and the previous developer had a modal banner on the home page, yet i cant find the actual elemet! Its not in CTA's and i dont see it in the modules... where else could this be living??

Is there a way to add a custom field for blog posts to show up on the listing page?
I have a blog called "Events" and i need the actual date of the event to be pulled through the listing view.

Hi everyone- this question may be for HubSpot partners. What are your best practices when onboarding a new client with custom integrations built by a previous partner? Do you manage the existing integration for your client as is?
For me the main differentiator here is; was it (a) built bespokely for the client who also owns the code+infra, or (b) a managed service the previous partner provided
What is the max number of options a dropdown property can have?
